args.content:
import Mathlib

/--
Let f : ‚Ñù^n ‚Üí ‚Ñù be differentiable at x0. Then the norm of the gradient equals the operator
norm of the derivative (sup over unit vectors):
  ‚Äñgradient f x0‚Äñ = sup { |fderiv ‚Ñù f x0 h| : ‚Äñh‚Äñ = 1 }.
We state this by equating the gradient norm with the continuous linear map operator norm.
-/
theorem norm_gradient_eq_opNorm_fderiv {n : ‚Ñï} (f : (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù) {x0 : Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù}
  (h : DifferentiableAt ‚Ñù f x0) :
  ‚Äñgradient f x0‚Äñ = ContinuousLinearMap.opNorm (fderiv ‚Ñù f x0) := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/--
Let f : ‚Ñù^n ‚Üí ‚Ñù be differentiable at x0. Then the norm of the gradient equals the operator
norm of the derivative (sup over unit vectors):
  ‚Äñgradient f x0‚Äñ = sup { |fderiv ‚Ñù f x0 h| : ‚Äñh‚Äñ = 1 }.
We state this by equating the gradient norm with the continuous linear map operator norm.
-/
theorem norm_gradient_eq_opNorm_fderiv {n : ‚Ñï} (f : EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin n) ‚Üí ‚Ñù) {x0 : EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin n)}
  (h : DifferentiableAt ‚Ñù f x0) :
  ‚Äñgradient f x0‚Äñ = ContinuousLinearMap.opNorm (fderiv ‚Ñù f x0) := by sorry
